record.Title: Shanghai February CNY Market Guide ğŸ“š Free Food & Fun Everywhere ğŸŠ
record.description_en:
ğŸ‰ February in Shanghai is absolutely buzzing with romance and CNY vibes ğŸ’

ğŸ”¥ So many Spring Festival lantern fairs, pop-ups, and markets happening - honestly it's almost overwhelming (in the best way!) âœ…

ğŸ I've rounded up 42 events total - the lineup is insane ğŸŠ

We're talking: BinggangÂ·Jinchao 8 Nong's "Year of the Horse" Shanghai-style New Year season, Yuyuan Lantern Festival, themed exhibitions for EVA, The Legend of Luo Xiaohei, Identity V, Aotu World, Zootopia 2, flower markets, Anpanman, Toy Story, Pingu themed restaurant, special pop-ups, anime/2D culture spots, stationery markets, Chigu cafes... and SO much more.

ğŸ™‹ğŸ»â€â™‚ï¸ Your class monitor here has organized all the best Shanghai February markets and activities for you
ğŸ§º Save this post ğŸ•¶, grab your friends and dive into the Spring Festival atmosphere â¤~

ğŸ­ Also welcome any of you to DM me with updates - I'll keep adding to this list!
record.practical_tips: Most markets are free entry but bring cash for food stalls as some vendors don't take cards. Yuyuan gets PACKED on weekends - go on weekdays or after 7pm for a better experience. Download Dianping (å¤§ä¼—ç‚¹è¯„) app to find exact locations and check opening hours.

filter.reason: Comprehensive guide to 42 February events in Shanghai including CNY markets, light shows, pop-ups, and themed exhibitions. Multiple specific venues mentioned (è±«å›­, ä»Šæ½®8å¼„, æ»¨æ¸¯). Time-sensitive seasonal content with mix of free events and trending activities locals would attend.

record.Title: A Northerner Celebrating Little New Year in Shanghai
record.description_en: Spent the day in Shanghai and had some amazing coffee at esc. - their Ethiopian combo is seriously delicious. Was a bit annoyed at first because there were no seats available, but then I noticed the pet adoption posters on the wall and my mood instantly lifted (and the coffee tasted even better somehow). Later headed to nico and on Huaihai Middle Road where I caught @å‡¡å‡  Common Rare's pop-up for Chinese New Year. So many creative products that gave me tons of new inspiration. Finished the day with a great dinner - will post about that later!

record.Title: Shanghai Gem | A Vintage Store with Impeccable Taste and Unique Aesthetic ğŸ«–
record.description_en:
Shanghai never runs out of interesting little shops to discover ğŸ’«
While wandering around Wuyuan Road, I finally checked out this vintage store that's been sitting in my bookmarks. Perfect timing too - they had just opened a new Year of the Horse themed exhibition ğŸ
The vintage tableware, cups, and plant vases are all beautifully curated and displayed. Definitely adding to my aesthetic inspiration bank â˜ï¸ This is one of those lovely spots I'll be coming back to again and again~

record.Title: 10 Must-Try Coffee Spots in Shanghai 2026
record.description_en:
Help! Shanghai's coffee scene is absolutely INSANE right now! â˜•ï¸

There's literally a cafÃ© every 30 meters â€“ we're talking nearly 10,000 coffee shops across the city... Shanghai truly lives up to being the city with the highest coffee density in the world! After trying countless spots, these 10 hidden gems are seriously worth checking out.
record.practical_tips: Most specialty coffee shops in Shanghai have English menus or can take orders via WeChat/Alipay. Download Dianping (å¤§ä¼—ç‚¹è¯„) app to find exact locations and see photos of drinks before ordering â€“ just show the staff the picture if there's a language barrier. Peak times are 10am-2pm on weekends, so go early or late afternoon to avoid queues.

filter.reason: Coffee guide featuring 10 local cafes in Shanghai. High engagement (182 collects) suggests genuine local interest. Author 'ShanghaiWOW' appears to be local content creator. While lacks specific addresses in caption, the list format and strong collection count indicates trending local spots worth investigating.
green_flags: High collect ratio (182 vs 102 likes) suggests practical value

record.Title: Via_NDN Store Visit: Hidden Gem Alert for Niche Fashion Lovers in Shanghai
record.description_en:
Via_NDN is the offline space for independent design brand Niente di N in Shanghai, but it's way more than just a storeâ€”it's basically a constantly evolving aesthetic hub.

They've curated multiple independent design brands under one roof! Besides the main brand Niente di N, you'll find dontouch, Serrer, TOATEE, STUDIO YI:AN and more. Everything from apparel and accessories to lifestyle objectsâ€”each piece has that unique, quality feel. Total paradise for niche fashion enthusiasts. The space itself is super tastefully designed too, every corner is Instagram-worthy.

Right now they're hosting a special collaboration:
ã€ŒHabiter x Via_NDN: Athens after Nightfallsã€
â° Running until May 21st
Feels like you're instantly transported to the gentle twilight streets of Athensâ€”the vibes are immaculate. No reservation needed, just drop by!

ğŸ“ Address: 878 Jiangsu Road, Changning District, Shanghai

record.Title: Tiny Counter-Seating Spot Serving Fire Sichuan-Chongqing Stir-Fry
record.description_en:
#ShanghaiEats #ShanghaiTravel

This super popular hole-in-the-wall only has a few counter seats where you can watch the chef work their magic with explosive Sichuan-Chongqing style stir-fry dishes (å·æ¸çˆ†ç‚’ - think intense heat, numbing Sichuan peppercorns, and bold flavors).
record.practical_tips: Expect to wait - these tiny counter spots (æ¿å‰ 'banqian') get packed fast, especially during dinner. If you can't handle extreme spice, learn to say 'wÄ“i lÃ ' (å¾®è¾£ - mild spicy) or 'bÃ¹ lÃ ' (ä¸è¾£ - no spicy) when ordering.

record.Title: No Hype, No Lines | 4 Hidden Gem Souvenir Shops Shanghai Locals Actually Love
record.description_en: What are Shanghai's real specialties? Besides White Rabbit candy and the eternally packed Guoji Hotel butterfly pastries, what else comes to mind? Today I'm sharing 4 authentic Shanghai souvenir spots that don't go crazy with fancy packaging and won't have you queuing forever - but they're seriously delicious (personally tested!). These places are pretty hidden, perfect for impressing people during Chinese New Year~
record.practical_tips: These hidden shops may not have English signs - screenshot the Chinese names or bring the post with you. Since they're local favorites, visit on weekdays if possible to avoid weekend crowds. Cash might be preferred at some traditional spots, though most accept WeChat/Alipay.

filter.reason: Local Shanghai food recommendations - 4 authentic souvenir/gift shops that locals love, no queues, no tourist crowds. High engagement (424 collects) shows strong local interest. Perfect for foreigners seeking authentic local food experiences.

record.Title: Hidden Gem in WujiaochangğŸ”¥Legendary Qingdao Zhizha Snack Shop Finally Opens in Shanghai!
record.description_en:
ğŸŒˆMy Qingdao friends have been raving about this place forever - the zhizha (crispy pork bits) shop they grew up eating at has FINALLY made it to Shanghai! Located in Hopson One Mall at Wujiaochang, I ran over as soon as I heard!
ğŸ‘‰ğŸ»Open kitchen where you can watch everything being made - tried a sample and was instantly hooked. Had to grab a huge bag!
âœ”ï¸Transparent process: Watch them make it fresh right in front of you
âœ”ï¸Slow-cooked perfection: Made at 140Â°C low temp to render out excess fat while keeping that meaty texture
âœ”ï¸Clean ingredients: Basically just pork + salt, no weird additives - even safe for kids
âœ”ï¸Heritage certified: Century-old Qingdao brand with intangible cultural heritage status, authentic taste approved by locals
ğŸ¥“Must-try signature flavors - both textures are amazing:
âœ…Crispy Pork Belly: Crunchy and shatters when you bite, gets more fragrant as you chew
âœ…Crispy-Soft Zhizha: Crispy outside, tender inside, pure pork flavor with great chew
ğŸ”¥Super affordable with coupons! Grabbed a big bag - perfect for Netflix binges or keeping in your office desk!
record.practical_tips: 1. Location: Hopson One Mall (åˆç”Ÿæ±‡) in Wujiaochang - take Metro Line 10 to Wujiaochang Station. 2. What to order: Try both the crispy pork belly and the soft zhizha versions - they'll usually give you samples. Ask for 'è¯•åƒ' (shÃ¬chÄ«) if you want to taste before buying. Look for coupons on their store page for discounts!

filter.reason: New food store opening in Wujiaochang (äº”è§’åœºåˆç”Ÿæ±‡) - authentic Qingdao specialty (ææ‘è„‚æ¸£) coming to Shanghai. Local snack recommendation with specific location, transparent preparation process, and traditional credentials (non-heritage certified). Good for foreigners interested in authentic Chinese regional foods.

record.Title: Shanghai's Got Its Own Zhongguo HotelğŸ¥£4 Must-Try Dongbei Restaurants
record.description_en:
#00:07 Qibao Da Dongbei
#00:53 Dongbei Four Seasons Dumpling King
#01:34 Jun Ge Dumpling King
#02:15 Helong Mingtai Wu (Longbai location)
#CNY Food Guide# #FoodVlog# #ShanghaiEats# #DongbeiCuisine# #NortheastChineseFood# #WorthTheYearLongWait#
record.practical_tips: Dongbei (Northeast Chinese) cuisine is hearty and generous with portions - perfect for sharing! The restaurants mentioned serve authentic dumplings (jiaozi), stews, and cold dishes. Most staff may not speak English, so have your phone ready with translation app or just point at pictures on the menu. Tip: Order the 'guo bao rou' (crispy sweet & sour pork) and handmade dumplings - they're signature Dongbei dishes.

filter.reason: Local recommendation of 4 authentic Northeast Chinese restaurants in Shanghai with specific names and timestamps. High engagement (1034 likes, 1356 collects) indicates trending local content. These are neighborhood eateries where locals go, not touristy spots.
green_flags: High collect rate suggests valuable local info

record.Title: Madang Road â• Xintiandi ğŸŒˆ Ultimate Citywalk Food Crawl Route
record.description_en: Perfect weekend food route combining Madang Road's hidden gems with Xintiandi's trendy spots! This citywalk takes you through some of Shanghai's best eats - from local favorites to Instagrammable cafes. Great for exploring the mix of old Shanghai vibes and modern food scene. #ShanghaiEats #Citywalk #WeekendPlans
record.practical_tips: 1) Start at Madang Road (é©¬å½“è·¯) - take Metro Line 9 to Madang Road Station. The area is super walkable from there to Xintiandi. 2) This route works best on weekends when you have time to leisurely hop between spots. Madang Road has more local-style eateries while Xintiandi skews more upscale, so bring cash for smaller shops and cards for Xintiandi establishments.

filter.reason: City walk food route covering Madang Road + Xintiandi area with specific local food spots. High engagement (883 collects) indicates popular route. Includes trending hashtags for Shanghai food exploration and citywalk culture.

record.Title: Hidden Gem Italian Restaurant in Gubei That Actually Slaps
record.description_en:
Classic Gubei vibes - this place feels like Japanese-style Italian, they even greet you in Japanese when you walk in ğŸ˜‚

Super low-key storefront that nobody seems to post about, but the food totally exceeded expectations.

Just look at the pics and you'll get it - that crab pasta in p1 has the creamiest sauce with rich crab flavor, and the pizza has that perfect charcoal-grilled taste. Love it!

Best part? Super affordable pricing.

record.Title: Rainy Day Visit to paper.d Stationery Shop in Shanghai â˜”ï¸
record.description_en: First thing I did after coming back to Shanghai was visit paper.d, a stationery and journal shop I've been dying to check out. It's located inside Xingqitian Park (æ˜ŸæœŸå¤©å…¬å›­) - you need to walk all the way to the back. The whole park area is beautiful, and the rainy day atmosphere made it even more charming and atmospheric.
record.practical_tips: 1. paper.d is tucked away at the far end of Xingqitian Park, so don't give up if you don't see it right away - keep walking! 2. Perfect spot for stationery lovers and journal enthusiasts. The park itself is worth exploring even if you're not into stationery shopping.

filter.reason: Local stationery/journal shop (paper.d) in Sunday Park - authentic local shopping experience with specific location. Niche interest but represents where Shanghai locals shop for curated goods.

record.Title: FOURNIL ğŸ¥¨ Where Bread Meets Life's Tender Moments
record.description_en:
Step into FOURNIL and you're instantly wrapped in the warm embrace of wheat and butterâ€”it feels like a gentle hug.

ğŸ¥– Pistachio Pretzel: The chewy pretzel exterior meets the creamy richness of pistachio in every bite. Sweet and salty dance together, leaving you wanting more.
ğŸ§€ French Cheese & Raisin: Rich cheese envelops the natural sweetness of raisins, with flaky layers that shatter perfectly. One bite and you're hooked.

This is bread that makes you slow down and savor the little joys in life.
record.practical_tips: Pro tip: Go early on weekends as popular items sell out fast. The pistachio pretzel (å¼€å¿ƒæœç¢±æ°´) is a must-try signature item. Staff speaks basic English, but pointing at what you want works perfectly. Cash and all major mobile payment apps accepted.

filter.reason: FOURNIL bakery in Shanghai - authentic French bakery popular with locals. Detailed review of specific items (pistachio pretzel, cheese raisin pastry). Location IP shows Shanghai, has good engagement (18 likes, 8 images), and tags indicate local food discovery spot. While no specific address given, FOURNIL is a known local bakery chain in Shanghai that locals frequent.

record.Title: My fave shoe store just opened at iapm! #rockfishweather Shanghai HKRI Taikoo Hui
record.description_en: My favorite shoe store just opened a new location at iapm! #rockfishweather Shanghai HKRI Taikoo Hui
record.practical_tips: iapm mall is located at Huaihai Zhong Lu (Line 1/10/13 Shaanxi Nan Lu station). Rockfish Weather is a Japanese weatherproof shoe brand known for stylish rain boots and waterproof footwear - super practical for Shanghai's rainy seasons!

record.Title: Shanghai's BEST Spanish Restaurant!!!
record.description_en:
Hands down the best Spanish restaurant in Shanghai for me.

It's in a standalone villa right by the Suzhou River ğŸ  Absolutely gorgeous for photos!!

Both the food and atmosphere are impeccable - you'll feel like you're instantly transported to Spain ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸

Their seafood paella ğŸ¥˜ lives up to all the hype!! Super generous portions and you can taste how fresh everything is ğŸ¦

Their new dessert "Rose Encounter" is both stunning and delicious

#ShanghaiFood #ShanghaiEats #SpanishFoodShanghai #AtmosphericDining #DateNight #HiddenGemRestaurant #WorthReturning #FeelsLikeAbroad

record.Title: Riverside Standalone Fujian Restaurant! Absolutely Top-Tier for Dinners & DatesğŸ‘
record.description_en: #ShanghaiMustEat #ShanghaiFoodie #ShanghaiRestaurantHunt #ShanghaiCheckin #ShanghaiEatDrinkPlay #ShanghaiFujianCuisine #ShanghaiTravel #ShanghaiGatherings #ShanghaiDateSpot #ShanghaiGuide
record.practical_tips: This is a standalone villa-style Fujian restaurant (Min Cai - cuisine from Fujian Province) by the riverside - perfect for impressing dates or hosting group dinners. Fujian cuisine features lighter, umami-rich flavors with lots of seafood and unique soups. Book ahead as these riverside spots fill up fast, especially on weekends. Try classic dishes like Buddha Jumps Over the Wall (ä½›è·³å¢™) if available.

filter.reason: Fujian cuisine restaurant by the river in Shanghai. Positioned as gathering/date spot. Low engagement but recent post with specific cuisine type and riverside location adds authenticity. Lacks specific address but describes unique setting (æ±Ÿè¾¹ç‹¬æ ‹).

If it has vintage purikura (retro Japanese photo booths), bring your friends and small bills - these machines usually don't give change!

record.Title: My Go-To Food Spots I Take Every Friend Visiting Shanghaiâ€¼ï¸
record.description_en: These are the places I always bring my friends when they visit Shanghai! Whether you're exploring the city, looking for authentic local eats, or hunting for hidden gem spots that won't break the bank - these are my tried-and-true recommendations. Perfect for weekend adventures and city walks through the old districts!
record.practical_tips: Tip 1: Old district food spots (è€å¸‚åŒº) are often cash-only or WeChat/Alipay only, so have your payment apps ready. Tip 2: Popular local restaurants fill up fast during lunch (11:30am-1pm) and dinner (5:30-7pm) - go slightly earlier or later to avoid the rush.

filter.reason: Local food recommendations for Shanghai visitors with authentic emphasis, but lacks specific restaurant names, addresses, or timing details. High collect ratio (12:1) suggests useful content despite low engagement.
